questions.question: I .......................... watch a movie if I have time.
questions.description: When the verb in the if-clause is in the simple present tense, we use will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: ....................................... you like something to eat?
questions.description: We use would in polite offers.

questions.question: 'I am starving.' 'I ............................. get you something to eat.'
questions.description: Will is used to announce decisions that we make at the time of speaking.

questions.question: I didn't think that I ........................................ pass the test.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we use would in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: If you asked me, I ....................................... help you.
questions.description: In the second conditional we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I .................................. stay up late if there was a good reason to.
questions.description: In the second conditional we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: Do you think she .................................... help if we asked her?
questions.description: In the second conditional we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I don't know whether I ..................................... come or not.
